data: In the 1970s, the concept of ‚Äúmigraine art‚Äù was developed. It refers to the idea that visual art is an appropriate and sometimes the most suitable medium for expressing and communicating the unique experiences of migraine sufferers.

This tool is not a medical diagnosis. It is based on internationally recognized criteria for migraine aura (ICHD-3), but its purpose is purely informational.
Neurological symptoms can have many different causes ‚Äî some of them serious. This tool assumes that the symptoms described are not better explained by another medical condition, such as epilepsy, stroke, multiple sclerosis, or a known eye disorder.
If your symptoms are new, unusual, worsening, or associated with other health issues, please consult a healthcare professional immediately.

Criterion C ‚Äì Aura Characteristics Please select all that apply to your most recent aura experience:
Aura symptom spreads gradually over ‚â•5 minutes
Two or more aura symptoms occur in succession
Each individual aura symptom lasts 5‚Äì60 minutes
At least one aura symptom is unilateral (on one side only)
At least one aura symptom is positive (e.g., flashing lights, tingling)
Aura is accompanied or followed within 60 minutes by headache

data:
Since 2000, we collected thousands of patient reports of migraine with aura.
With encyclopaedic-worthy detail, we have sorted these reports into 20 basic aura types with over 30 aura subforms.
¬ªEvery patient with classical migraine opened out, as it were, into an entire encyclopaedia of neurology¬´ ‚Äì Oliver Sacks in his book Migraine.
